intro: Lycium megistocarpum var. lanceolatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf boxthorn, is a shrub native to parts of Asia and Australia. It features small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by red, fleshy berries that are edible for humans and wildlife. The plant has spiny stems and lance-shaped leaves, which are typically dark green and glossy. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. The berries are a key food source for various bird species and can be used in traditional medicine.
